headline: Prediction: The S&P 500 $1 Trillion Club Will Double Between 2026 and 2030
summary: Several companies could see massive gains by 2030 to join the vaunted club.

content.title: Prediction: The S&P 500 $1 Trillion Club Will Double Between 2026 and 2030

headline: Dow Jones Futures: AMD, Apple, Palantir, Tesla Are Key Movers; Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Announces New AI Chip
summary: Dow Jones Futures: AMD, Apple, Palantir and Tesla were key movers. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced the company's new AI chip.

content.title: Dow Jones Futures: AMD, Apple, Palantir, Tesla Are Key Movers; Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Announces New AI Chip
content.summary: Dow Jones Futures: AMD, Apple, Palantir and Tesla were key movers. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced the company's new AI chip.

headline: Goodbye, gas! Why this electric boat is making waves
summary:
STORY: Carving silently across Lake Mead, a reservoir situated about 30 minutes southeast of Las Vegas, Nevada, this boat offers a glimpse of a future where water sports leave nothing behind but a clean wake.

The all-electric wake sport boat is part of its creators' bold bet that the marine world is ready to go electric.

:: Carbon Shift

Built by California-based startup Arc and designed by a team of former Tesla and Rivian engineers, the 23-foot Arc Sport EV brings Silicon Valley to the water.

Mitch Lee is the co-founder of Arc.

:: Mitch Lee, Co-founder and CEO of Arc

“It's a fully electric wake sport boat, 23 feet, 500 horsepower. It has a giant battery on board and it gives you hours of fun out on the water without any of the fumes, any of the of noise, any maintenance burdens of a gas boat."

“On the water, the Arc Sport gives you an experience that is quieter, you don't have the fumes from a gas engine. It's more performant, you have so much more power and torque available to you. It's all software enabled, and it's actually cheaper to operate. More convenient to charge a boat overnight than it is to lug gas cans down to the dock. And then once you take it off of the water, you don't have the maintenance headaches, you don't need to winterize it."

According to Lee, on a single charge, the boat can handle four to six hours of active use, with an overnight charge on a Level 2 charger delivering a full battery by morning.

Beyond the powertrain, Arc leans heavily into software.

“With one touch of a button, you can configure the balance system, the control surfaces, the cruise control for it, to throw that perfect surf wave on one side of the boat or the other."

"I think that electric boats make even more sense, that electric cars have pretty stiff competition in gas cars. Those gas cars are reliable, they're inexpensive, they are convenient, they are quiet, they've had a bunch of money put into R&D over the span of 100 years. Gas boats are not the same level of competition. And by going electric, you solve a bunch of very acute pain points with owning a gas boat."

But Arc's technology comes at a premium.

The Arc Sport EV boat starts at $268,000.

Yet Lee says demand has not been an issue, with the wake sport boat being just the beginning.

“We've already announced our next product that comes after this, which is a center console boat for fishing and leisure activities, and have also expanded into the commercial space as well. Larger vessels, harbor craft, you can think of tugboats and ferries, so taking that same technology and scaling it up to those applications."

headline: One in four electric cars sold in Britain are Chinese
summary: More than one in four electric vehicles (EVs) sold in the UK are now made in China, as Beijing helps to power Britain’s shift away from petrol and diesel.

content.title: One in four electric cars sold in Britain are Chinese
content.summary: More than one in four electric vehicles (EVs) sold in the UK are now made in China, as Beijing helps to power Britain’s shift away from petrol and diesel.
